sub_title: 💻 Founding Product Engineer @ Coho || 🇳🇱 MSc Engineering & Policy @ TU Delft || 🌏 '21 Cansbridge || 👨‍🎓 University of Toronto Engineering Alum || 🏛️ ex-On Deck
summary:
Hey, I'm Morris 👋 

💻 Founding Product Engineer at Coho
🌍 MSc Engineering and Policy Analysis student at TU Delft ($160K+ scholarship)
💡 Advisor at Global Spark (prev. Senior Managing Director)
👨‍🎓 University of Toronto Engineering grad
📍 Den Haag, Netherlands

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Applied Science - BASc Honours

awards.title: Faculty Scholarship for TU Delft (€52,000)
awards.description:
Awarded to an excellent international applicant admitted to one of the 2-year TU Delft’s MSc programmes with a cumulative GPA of 80% or higher of the scale maximum in the bachelor’s degree from an internationally renowned university outside The Netherlands.

Full tuition fees per year for a TU Delft MSc programme based on the statutory fee or institutional rate, according to the registered nationality, and the living expenses.
awards.issuer: TU Delft, Faculty of Technology, Policy, and Analysis

awards.title: Holland Scholarship (€5,000)
awards.description: Awarded to an excellent applicant from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) who has been admitted to one of the 2-year Regular TU Delft’s MSc programmes with a bachelor’s degree from an internationally renowned university outside The Netherlands.
awards.issuer: TU Delft, Faculty of Technology, Policy, and Analysis

awards.title: Troost ILead Difference Maker Award ($50,000)

• First recipient of the Troost ILead Difference Maker Award ($50,000 CAD)
• Awarded to a graduating engineering student who has a proven record of leadership and influence and a vision of how I will work towards making my community a better place post-graduation

projects.title: Master thesis: Building a Sustainable Future of Education: An Investigation into the Sustainability of Digital Education Technologies in European Higher Education Institutions
projects.description:
• Studied sustainability considerations in the university’s digital infrastructure to develop sustainable DET selection strategies
• Utilized stakeholder interviews and technical data analysis to identify problems in the DET selection process & constructed a multidimensional framework for decision-makers to evaluate tools for sustainability along with policy recommendations
• Research funded by the European Union and presented at the 2023 International Sustainability Transitions Conference

contributors.headline: 💻 Founding Product Engineer @ Coho || 🇳🇱 MSc Engineering & Policy @ TU Delft || 🌏 '21 Cansbridge || 👨‍🎓 University of Toronto Engineering Alum || 🏛️ ex-On Deck

projects.title: Drinking Water Treatment and Management System
projects.description:
• Designed a rainwater harvesting system and Excel model using a 25-year rainfall dataset to provide a year-round supply of potable water (250L/day), reduce daily water trips, and decrease waterborne diseases for 26 rural households
• Constructed an education program to train 150 people on fundamental sanitary and water management practices

contributors.headline: 💻 Founding Product Engineer @ Coho || 🇳🇱 MSc Engineering & Policy @ TU Delft || 🌏 '21 Cansbridge || 👨‍🎓 University of Toronto Engineering Alum || 🏛️ ex-On Deck

projects.title: Land Classification from Satellite Images
projects.description: • Created an automated terrain classification ML model of satellite images to track land development and environmental changes due to climate change; cleaned and organized a 62,000-image dataset and achieved 97% test accuracy

contributors.headline: 💻 Founding Product Engineer @ Coho || 🇳🇱 MSc Engineering & Policy @ TU Delft || 🌏 '21 Cansbridge || 👨‍🎓 University of Toronto Engineering Alum || 🏛️ ex-On Deck

projects.title: Nuclear Rescue Rover
projects.description:
• Designed a solar powered rover to traverse uneven terrain and recover nuclear cargo via a mechanical gripper
• Directed the preliminary research and analysis of rescue rovers, managed the material selection process of the entire assembly, and designed the chassis and mechanical gripper components using Solidworks 
• Produced a 53-page final project report with accompanying Solidworks CAD and motion analysis

contributors.headline: 💻 Founding Product Engineer @ Coho || 🇳🇱 MSc Engineering & Policy @ TU Delft || 🌏 '21 Cansbridge || 👨‍🎓 University of Toronto Engineering Alum || 🏛️ ex-On Deck

profile_positions.description:
• Built and maintained the entire company’s infrastructure and databases in 2 months using Zapier, Airtable, Typeform, and Python
•  Managed 12 technical projects to develop the fellowship community platform (Circle) using data-driven decision-making and collaborated with Operations, Sales and Engineering teams, tracked success metrics, and wrote 30+ documentation guides
• Created 50+ automation and internal tools that optimized tasks and operations across all teams, saving 100+ hours/week
profile_positions.title: Founding Product Engineer

profile_positions.description:
• Managed a non-profit startup of 100+ executives to educate & mobilize university students in global development & social entrepreneurship; scaled the organization in 3 years to achieve 10x growth and engage 10,000+ students annually
• Established partnerships with 8 global universities and 40+ organizations including Google, BCG, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, WWF, and the University of Toronto; secured $55,000+ in sponsorship and academic funding
• Headed the development and integration of multidisciplinary problem-solving content to 7,000+ students across 50 courses by leading the design and execution of a systematic course partnership process with 45+ professors and TAs
• Built a sustainable national talent pipeline by devising and executing hiring strategies to onboard a team of 100+

Past initiatives:
• Launched the Global Engineering Fair initiative to educate students about global challenges around the world in an interactive manner through games, 3D printed models, and case studies, engaging over 500 students
• Liaised and established an international partnership with the Sustainable Engineering Association of Brazil by co-creating 11-course activities for their Sustainability Week focused on South America based challenges
profile_positions.title: Senior Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
• Facilitated 3 ODNC fellowships to build the leading international no-code community of 450+ builders/founders through creating program curricula, hosting 4+ weekly virtual events, and automating day-to-day operations using no-code tools
• Built and implemented 20+ automation workflows and internal tools that optimized the company’s backend infrastructure and operations using Airtable, Zapier, Typeform, Notion, and Coda, saving the company 20+ hours/week
• Led a team of 13 and spearheaded ODNC3’s trademark Demo Day by securing judges, organizing event operations, and developing a new judging infrastructure using Coda, leading to a 97% increase in attendance and 37 project pitches
profile_positions.title: On Deck No-Code Program Associate

profile_positions.description:
On Deck is where top tech talent and ambitious builders go to start or join something new, or accelerate their careers. We are building a modern education institution; a platform serving the many strands of the identity of ambitious people who want to change the world.

www.beondeck.com
profile_positions.title: Launch Operations Intern

profile_positions.description: • Led a team of 21 to spearhead hybrid recruitment efforts and build partnerships with 8 Canadian universities. Successfully increased top-of-funnel applications by 30% and selected 23 new fellows for the 2022 cohort.
profile_positions.title: Recruitment Lead

profile_positions.description: • Selected to join a cohort of 20 fellows and an exclusive global network of entrepreneurs, leaders, and risk-takers to take part in a self-organized Asia Summer Internship with a $10,000 scholarship (450+ applicants, <4% acceptance rate)
profile_positions.title: Fellow

company.name: Action Against Hunger / Action contre la Faim Canada

profile_positions.company: Action Against Hunger / Action contre la Faim Canada
profile_positions.description:
• Action Against Hunger submitted a proposal to the Clean Water Foundation for project funding based on my capstone team's proposed solution to implement our solution in San Antonio Palopó, Guatemala 
• Designed a rainwater harvesting system and Excel model using a 25-year rainfall dataset to provide a year-round supply of potable water (250L/day), reduce daily water trips, and decrease waterborne diseases for 26 rural households
• Developed an education program to train 150 local residences on fundamental sanitary & water management practices
profile_positions.title: Multidisciplinary Capstone Design Project

profile_positions.description:
• Facilitated a tutorial section of 68 students for APS100 (Orientation to Engineering), a course designed to assist 1st year students to transition into university
• Worked directly with Prof. Variawa (Director of First-year Curriculum) and UofT’s First Year Office to develop 10 hours of curriculum content on learning strategies, teamwork, communication, mental wellness, and stress management skills
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Drove the investigation of new sustainable industrial gases to improve the existing thin-film plasma etching capabilities and enhance memory and semiconductor applications using 300mm silicon wafer plasma etcher, SEM, XPS, and OES
• Optimized 200 etching experiments’ data analyses and reporting by reducing a 2-week data manipulation process to under 20 minutes using Python and drafted a 38-page user manual; the program is currently used by ALL Japan and USA
• The original 12-month internship was reduced to 8 months due to the COVID-19 pandemic
profile_positions.title: R&D Process Engineer Intern

profile_positions.description: • Marketed and established 17 new partnerships with the University of Toronto student clubs and faculties that resulted in 6 cross-disciplinary collaborative initiatives and a 10% growth in non-engineering club members over 5 months
profile_positions.title: Vice President of Outreach - University of Toronto Chapter

profile_positions.description:
• Partnered with 5 Toronto NGOs to create learning opportunities for 25 portfolio members through technical and non-technical projects to assist NGOs in furthering their missions; delivered 5 successful projects over 8 months
• Managed 38 members to impact students’ knowledge of the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals
• Launched the Green Plastics Article Competition to provided students the opportunity to conduct research on plastic pollution and present their research findings in the Society of Plastic Engineers magazine
profile_positions.title: Vice President,  Evolving Engineering Portfolio Lead - University of Toronto Chapter

profile_positions.description:
• Spearheaded the development of electroactive thermal shape memory polymer (SMP) with low temperature actuation by incorporating carbon nanotubes and plasticizers into the SMP matrix using wet chemistry lab techniques
• Improved SMP cyclic loading ability by 50%, lowered temperature actuation by 62%, and enhanced the shape memory recovery rate by 49% through 20 parametric studies and SMP characterization analysis using SEM, DMA and MS Office
• Produced weekly reports in MS PowerPoint for lab supervisors’ review and presented research development findings at the department seminar and the University of Toronto Undergraduate Research Day Competition (UnERD)

• Skills learned: Scanning Electron Microscope, Dynamic Mechanical Analysis, Differential Scanning Calorimetry, Thermogravimetric Analysis, Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy, Dielectric Analysis
profile_positions.title: Polymer Engineer Summer Researcher

volunteer_experiences.description:
• Secured $2800 in funding from academic sources and corporate sponsors
• Managed budget for 3 student workshop and 1 industry tour that resulted in 15% operational savings

I coached athletes with mental disabilities in swimming and help improve their strokes for their competitions. I create weekly lesson plans and coach 2-3 athletes per week. Athletes range in skill and age from 5 years old to young adults.

• Taught children, ages 4 - 10, water safety, first aid, and swimming strokes
• Created weekly lesson plans, consult with parents and supervisors on helping every kid excel in my class
• All 20 classes (5 - 7 kids/class) completed my course and exceeded in subsequence lessons

• Attended classes regularly for ECE110 (Electrical Fundamentals) and took notes of all 14 weeks of lectures
• Uploaded 42 lecture notes online for University of Toronto students who are unable to attend lectures physically
